verses.roman:
tatra vai vārṣitān māsān
avātsīt svārtha-sādhakaḥ
pauraiḥ sabhājito 'bhīkṣṇaṁ
rāmeṇājānatā ca saḥ

synonyms: tatra—there; vai—indeed; vārṣikān—of the rainy season; māsān—for the months; avātsīt—he resided; sva—his own; artha—purpose; sādhakaḥ—trying to achieve; pauraiḥ—by the people of the city; sabhājitaḥ—honored; abhīkṣṇam—constantly; rāmeṇa—by Lord Balarāma; ajānatā—who was unaware; ca—and; saḥ—he.
translation: He stayed there during the monsoon months to fulfill his purpose. Lord Balarāma and the other residents of the city, not recognizing him, offered him all honor and hospitality.
